pageContext.patina: Dull greenish grey, with brown stains.
pageContext.associations: Part of a hoard, label: "one of a deposit of bronze reliques found 1835") - 200 or 300 broken spears said to be found together with 3 or 4 small whetstones and a celt.
pageContext.publications: Evans, B. Imps., Hoard No. 41, Hartshorne's Salopia Antiqua, p. 95, this specimen is not given in the plate, but may be No. 3 or 5 - page 96, although only the best specimens are noted.,Salopia Ant. pp. 94-7,Evans, B. Imps. p. 285-338 (Ref. Arch XXVI, 464),S.A.T. IV (2nd S.) 279,Vic. Co. His. I, 203,S.A.T.(?) C (2nd S) 108 (1898 Exhibition).
pageContext.collection: Shrewsbury Museum,Donor Mr. E. R. Watkings about 1902 date omitted in D. Bk.,7B Devenport Road, Shephard's Bush, W.
pageContext.toSearch: Little Wenlock, Telford, Telford And Wrekin Tf6, UK
